alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Pike; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike, east central Polk and southern Montgomery Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little Missouri Falls Recreation Area to near Albert Pike Recreation Area. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Norman... Oden... Daisy... Mimosa... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Caney Creek Wilderness... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Daisy State Park... Black Springs... Big Fork... Salem in Pike County... Welsh... Lodi... Langley... Pine Ridge... Shady Lake Recreation Area... Fancyhill... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
